events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred last night at an intersection. The vehicle sustained significant front-end damage.
The claim has been categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the damage and incident details provided.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the case, with instructions to provide timely updates to the customer.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the investigation would commence shortly.
Requested the customer to submit photographs of the vehicle damage, police report, and the accident report number.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the damaged car and the official police accident report.
The investigation team began analyzing the details and evidence surrounding the vehicle collision to verify the claim.
The investigation concluded that the customer's vehicle damage was consistent with the reported accident circumstances.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and temporary transportation expenses.
The customer responded with satisfaction regarding the proposed settlement amount and the responsiveness of the claims process.
The claim was officially approved, with the settlement amount confirmed to cover all eligible damages and losses.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer's nominated bank account for the approved settlement amount.
The claim case was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation of customer acceptance.
The claim records were archived for future reference, completing the administrative closure process.
